catalogue.message: The field's incoming contains a bad character. The element may NOT contain: periods, underscores, or spaces.
The field's incoming is to long, it must be less than 32 characters.
The field's outgoing is to long, it must be less than 32 characters.
The field's outgoing contains a bad character. The outgoing may NOT contain: periods, underscores, or spaces.

The term registry maintains a list of all fields available in the repository. These fields may be divided amongst multiple schemas. However, DSpace requires the qualified Dublin Core schema. You may extend the Dublin Core schema with additional fields or add new schemas to the registry.
Namespace should be an established URI location for the new term schema.

Shorthand notation for the term schema. This will be used to prefix a field's name (e.g. dc.element.qualifier). The name must be less than 32 characters and cannot include spaces, periods or underscores.
This field is required and must be less than 32 characters and cannot contain any spaces, periods, or underscores.

The concept registry maintains a list of all fields available in the repository. These fields may be divided amongst multiple schemas. However, DSpace requires the qualified Dublin Core schema. You may extend the Dublin Core schema with additional fields or add new schemas to the registry.
Namespace should be an established URI location for the new concept schema.

Shorthand notation for the concept schema. This will be used to prefix a field's name (e.g. dc.element.qualifier). The name must be less than 32 characters and cannot include spaces, periods or underscores.
This field is required and must be less than 32 characters and cannot contain any spaces, periods, or underscores.

The term registry maintains a list of all fields available in the repository. These fields may be divided amongst multiple schemas. However, DSpace requires the qualified Dublin Core schema. You may extend the Dublin Core schema with additional fields or add new schemas to the registry.
Namespace should be an established URI location for the new term schema.

Shorthand notation for the term schema. This will be used to prefix a field's name (e.g. dc.element.qualifier). The name must be less than 32 characters and cannot include spaces, periods or underscores.
This field is required and must be less than 32 characters and cannot contain any spaces, periods, or underscores.

The concept relation registry maintains a list of all fields available in the repository. These fields may be divided amongst multiple schemas. However, DSpace requires the qualified Dublin Core schema. You may extend the Dublin Core schema with additional fields or add new schemas to the registry.
Add a new concept relation schema
Namespace should be an established URI location for the new concept relation schema.

Shorthand notation for the concept relation schema. This will be used to prefix a field's name (e.g. dc.element.qualifier). The name must be less than 32 characters and cannot include spaces, periods or underscores.
This field is required and must be less than 32 characters and cannot contain any spaces, periods, or underscores.
